bibl.title: From Logos to Myth: Egyptian Petitions of the 5th-7th Centuries.
bibl.note: The rhetorical style in Byzantine petitions. In proems and conclusions, the petitioner addresses the official in a humble way; the body of the petition demonstrates not the author's servility, but his courage and honesty.
KOVELMAN Arkady B., From Logos to Myth: Egyptian Petitions of the 5th-7th Centuries.
